column2: Document Title: CHK-008-CIV-CPD-RSS Walls-Pre-cast Panel Installation
ITP Description: RSS Walls - Panel Installation
ITP created by: Matthew Dib/Jason Quan
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Reference: VR 682.20 IFC Drawings MRP-080-C-RFL-DRG-33-CPV-CSW-1001 and 1202 to 1205
Acceptance Criteria: Plan position shown on the drawings at the base of the wall shall not exceed ±15mm (refer to drawings for WP locations)
Acceptance Criteria: Mark number of strips per row on the back of each panel. Mark design location (Wall number, row and column) as per elevation drawings on the back of each panel
Acceptance Criteria: RSS Panels are to be installed as per IFC Drawings and specified schedule.
– Check the 1 in 40 slope is to be maintained
Acceptance Criteria: 3X19mm bearing pads must be installed per panel - Centre of the outer bearing pads must be 200mm+/-10mm from the edge of the panel
– Check the 19mm nominal gap to be maintained
– Install 3 Bearing Pads at rear on top of panels
– Above must be checked with Surveyor prior to backfill
– Note bearing pads shall not be installed under base row panels
Reference: IFC Drawings MRP-080-C-RFL-DRG-33-CPV-CSW-1106, MRP-080-C-SME-DRG-34-CPV-CSF-3023 and 3024
Acceptance Criteria: Panel installation and abutment interfaces
– 20mm nominal gap between panels and Abutment wall is to be mainatined
– 150mm wide x 6mm Folded Galvanized plates (Grade 250) drill and fix to as per IFC drawings with Galvanized M12x75 Long Excalibur screwbolts at 500 CTRS Typical each wall.
Acceptance Criteria: Install Filter Fabric against all vertical and horizontal joints
Frequency: Each course of panel installation

Acceptance Criteria: Install 300mm wide strip drain between precast wall panel vertical joints. Strip drain to be encapsulated by nonwoven geotextile in accordance with section 682.11 At every vertival joint between panels in RSS wall, ensure no gap is formed bewteen strip drian and RSS panels
Frequency: Each course of panel installation

Acceptance Criteria: To ensure compliance with the tolerances specified in clause 682.20, the Contractor shall install stable and permanent survey reference points on a not more than 5 m (horizontal) by 2 m (vertical) grid covering the whole face of the RSS
Frequency: Each course of panel installation
9 - Traceability of precast units and records
Acceptance Criteria: Unique ID of precast panel is recorded.
– ATTACH: marked-up elevation drawings or installation record with reference to panel ID
Reference: IFC Drawings VR 682.06, VR 682.17, VR 682.20

Acceptance Criteria: The level and alignment of each course of facing panels shall be checked progressively after placement of each course and prior to placement of the next course to ensure compliance with the dimensional and positional tolerances stated in the design.  The
○ Contractor shall record the results of this checking together with details of any non-conformances and the associated corrective actions
– Relative displacement of adjoining smooth panel faces shall not exceed ±15mm measured normal to face of the wall
– Local deviation of the wall face at any location with a 3m straight edge, shall not exceed 15mm
– Variation in gap width between facing panels shall not exceed 5mm per meter length and 10mm over the full length of the gap
– The wall level shall not deviate from the specified level by more than ±20mm
– The tolerance of position measured at the top of the wall face shall not excedd 5mm per 1m of wall height
– The verticality of the RSS wall facing shall lean backward at a minimum slope of 1(H) in 40 (V)
Frequency: Each course of panel installation

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
